title: How to Make Vegan Sweet Potato Casserole

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 C) and coat a 13" x 9" baking pan with cooking spray.
Place the sweet potatoes in a Dutch oven over high heat and cover them with water.
steps.description: Bring them to a boil, and then reduce the heat to medium and simmer them for 20 minutes, uncovered.

steps.headline: Drain the boiling water and cool the sweet potatoes for 5 minutes in a large mixing bowl.
Mix 1-1/2 teaspoons (7.5 grams) of non-dairy milk powder with 1/4 cup (59 milliliters) of water in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar, 3 tablespoons (45 grams) melted vegan butter, salt and vanilla extract to the mixture. Pour the mixture over the sweet potatoes.

steps.headline: Beat the sweet potato mixture with an electric mixer at medium speed until the mixture is smooth.
steps.description: Add the egg replacer and beat the mixture well.

steps.headline: Pour the sweet potato mixture into the baking pan.
Combine the flour, brown sugar and salt in a clean mixing bowl.
Whisk the flour mixture together gently with a hand whisk until it is well combined.
Fold two tablespoons (30 grams) melted vegan butter into the flour mixture using a wooden spoon
Sprinkle the flour mixture evenly over the sweet potato mixture.
Sprinkle the pecans evenly over the top of the sweet potato mixture.
Bake the sweet potato casserole uncovered for 25 minutes or until the topping turns golden.
Remove the casserole from the oven.
Broil the casserole for 45 seconds or until the topping is bubbly.
Set the casserole aside for 10 minutes before serving it.

text: Preparing the Sweet Potatoes Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 C) and coat a 13" x 9" baking pan with cooking spray.  Place the sweet potatoes in a Dutch oven over high heat and cover them with water. Bring them to a boil, and then reduce the heat to medium and simmer them for 20 minutes, uncovered. Drain the boiling water and cool the sweet potatoes for 5 minutes in a large mixing bowl.  Mix 1-1/2 teaspoons (7.5 grams) of non-dairy milk powder with 1/4 cup (59 milliliters) of water in a mixing bowl. Add the sugar, 3 tablespoons (45 grams) melted vegan butter, salt and vanilla extract to the mixture. Pour the mixture over the sweet potatoes. Beat the sweet potato mixture with an electric mixer at medium speed until the mixture is smooth. Add the egg replacer and beat the mixture well. Pour the sweet potato mixture into the baking pan.  Preparing the Topping Combine the flour, brown sugar and salt in a clean mixing bowl.  Whisk the flour mixture together gently with a hand whisk until it is well combined.  Fold two tablespoons (30 grams) melted vegan butter into the flour mixture using a wooden spoon  Sprinkle the flour mixture evenly over the sweet potato mixture.  Sprinkle the pecans evenly over the top of the sweet potato mixture.  Bake the sweet potato casserole uncovered for 25 minutes or until the topping turns golden.  Remove the casserole from the oven.  Preheat the broiler.  Broil the casserole for 45 seconds or until the topping is bubbly.  Set the casserole aside for 10 minutes before serving it.  Finished.
